results.title: Emulation of Choplifter II for Game Boy
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, cartridge case and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: In this sequel to Choplifter!, the player has to fly a rescue helicopter through levels to pick up stranded hostages. Complicating matters are the planes, bullets and even aggressive birds that get in the helicopter’s way, not to mention buildings and hills. Rescuing a given number of hostages will complete a level and saving more hostages than required leads to extra points and lives. Inversely, taking too much damage or losing too many hostages will lead to lost extra lives.
results.title_for_label: Emulation of Choplifter II for Game Boy

results.title: Hudson
results.creator_credit: Robert Heazlewood, Corporate Communications and Tasmanian Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Player Profile Series”.
Football statistics reveal that there has never been a finer spearhead in the history of Australian Rules Football than Peter Hudson. Historical highlights and interviews provide an insight into the game’s most potent offensive player and prolific goal kicking machine.

results.title: Grateful Dead: anthem to beauty
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Marre, Daniel Television, Grateful Dead Productions and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
The Grateful Dead, known for their experimentation and individual approach to music and performance have sustained a career in live performances since the mid 60’s (originating from the San Francisco Bay area). Infamous for their experimentation with music and hallucinogenic drugs, the band are also well known for their loyal fans (known as ‘deadheads’), who have travelled consistently with the band for 30 years. Priceless interviews recounting many humourous and bizarre tales are told in such a ‘matter of fact’ manner, chronicling their journey from experimental “Anthem of the Sun”, to the accessible “American Beauty”. Featuring interviews with core band members; Jerry Garcia, Phil Lesh, Bob Weir, Ron ‘Pigpen’ McKerman, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann, which includes amongst others a rare interview with lyricist Robert Hunte. Other contributors include David Crosby, biographer Dennis McNally, keyboard virtuoso Tom Constanten, producer Steven Barnaco, legendary engineer Dan Healy and Warner Records chief Joe Smith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeremy Marre, Daniel Television, Grateful Dead Productions and Isis Productions

results.title: The Islands of Torres Strait
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Torres Strait is a treacherous waterway between Cape York, the northern most tip of the Australian mainland and Papua New Guinea. The shallow strait is dotted with Islands and coral outcrops. From Possession Island at the southern extremity, Captain James Cook formally laid claim to the Australian colonies in the name of England. Later the Queensland Government moved to control the Islands of the Strait and their people. Once, the islanders currency of trade was human heads, and headhunting raids between the islands and mainland Papua New Guinea was part of life. On this journey through the islands, Ted Egan meets some old friends, sees dugout canoes being built and meets the keeper of the legendary Drums of Mer.

results.title: Norfolk Island: From Hell to Paradise
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Norfolk Island is an eight by six kilometre paradise set in the blue waters of the South West Pacific Ocean about 1,500 kilometres east of the Australian mainland. The island was secured by the British in 1788 just a few weeks after settlement at Sydney Cove. It was abandoned after a few years, until 1824 when it became one of the most terrible and feared penal settlements. The graveyards and chronicles testify to the brutality and terror of those awful years. The island was abandoned but eventually re-settled by descendants of the Bounty mutineers who moved there from the more isolated Pitcairn Island in 1856.

results.title: The Jewel in the Crown. V.5. a Nation Born
results.brief_description: India hovers between dream and nightmare. The British have departed India, the nation is gripped by terror and violence. Long repressed by colonial rule, the vicious feud between Muslim and Hindu now erupts into butchery, rioting and murder. Rated: M

results.title: Broome and the Pearl Coast
results.creator_credit: Martyn Down, John Mabey, Rhonda Mabey, AFFC and Sorena
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Broome, in the remote north-west of Australia is famous for its pearling industry. Travelling the breadth of the Pearl Coast, Ted Egan encounters a number of extraordinary people like Yoshinori Maeda who came to Australia as a young man to fish, but decided to stay. The vast panoramic coast and desert of the north-west is explored, including the beautiful splendour of Deepwater Point, 200kms from Broome.

results.title: Central Australia: The Eighth Wonder
results.creator_credit: Martyn Down, John Mabey, Rhonda Mabey and Sorena P
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
A visual kaleidoscope of the Red Centre’s picturesque wonders. It is also the part of Australia that Ted Egan calls home. Australia’s foremost bush storyteller takes us on a journey through a landscape where travel is still an adventure.

results.title: The Lost World Jurassic Park for Game Boy
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, cartridge case, consumer information booklet, Nintendo Power subscription form, registration card, poster and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Based on the movie of the same name, The Lost World: Jurassic Park is set on Isla Sorna, also known as “Site B”, where dinosaurs were created to populate the original park. As an agent for InGen, the player must recover eggs, DNA and key information on the cloning process before BioSyn, a rival company, gets their hands on it. Gameplay consists of running, jumping and climbing through the buildings, jungles and caves of the island. Getting in the player’s way are BioSyn thugs and a variety of dinosaurs, such as Pterodactyl, Triceratops and the eponymous Tyrannosaurus Rex. The player can defend himself by using kicks, punches and weapons, as well as ammo and health power-ups.
